rComments: Disorganized. Just completely out of sync all the time. If you intend to skip out on class or show up late for good reasons, she'll call you out and make you regret it. Weekly reflections, an "art file" midterm and a final paper. Easy A for the little amount of work she gives but be ready for discussions and show up to class.

This course lacked any organization or structure whatsoever and she is very unclear about she wants from students. There are so many readings and I never got anything out of her lectures, which were very tangential and lacking in direction. She's a nice lady but this class was a genuinely terrible/confusing/stressful experience.

She is very unstructured. Though extremely knowledgeable, she is awful at conducting a class where students are focused and on track with what she is teaching. Mandatory attendance with daily notecards. No tests, midterm and final projects only (which are very vague and odd). Am not enjoying this class at all.

Scatterbrained, disorganized, unhelpful. She is smart and knows her material but she NEEDS to stop teaching. She seems in a good state of mind to continue individual research but she is an awful instructor and is doing a disservice to her students. You will be very confused most of the time you are in her class. Nice lady though.
You can only get the most of this class by going to office hours and paying attention to the discussions during class.  Professor Errington is very nice and knowledgeable about what she teaches.

(cont.)As others here have said. This lady should not be teaching at UCSC. Disorganised. Scatterbrained. No solid methodology taught. No rules. Admitted she lets her kids grade her final projects. Overall, a Post-Modernistic exercise in discursive theory. Pointless stupidity. Broke my heart and love for 100+ years of now wasted science. Tears :(

I busted my butt through years of college to get to the point to take this class. Ethnographic research was my "dream" and specialization in Cultural Anthropology. This lady destroyed that dream. How? Post Modernism. This class is completely unstructured, more like biography writing. UC gladly took my 40K and im working at starbucks now. All Lies.

I like Shelly, but she needs to cut back on her other obligations.  Hearing her say "I'm stretched really thin" in class is not something I hoped to experience.  She frequently forgot to post assignments, gave unclear prompts, and often, we talked about school politics (which, while I am interested in, I took a class to learn to write ethnography).
Shelly should not be teaching. This was the most redundant class that I have ever taken - I don't need to hear about budget cuts every class session. Don't even give her the benefit of the doubt.

The class created discussion but not on the actual course's top - culture through film. Most of the class time is spent talking about budget cuts and fee hikes. She is enthusiastic about what she does but does not know how to facilitate the class' time and discussion. I'd advise everyone to stay away, far away.

THIS IS THE WORST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER HAD! She is disorganized, vague, has trouble staying on any topic during lecture, rarely responded to emails, consistently late to class, and can talk of nothing but budget cuts. She is a nice, caring person but, clearly, not a teacher in any sense. Just don't.
Shelly has no idea how to teach. If you like to be confused and frustrated, this is the class for you. She needs to retire and whoever is reading this should never take a class from her.

Simple - don't take her. If she's teaching a class that interests you, chances are that any optimism that you may have had towards the course in the beginning will be washed away after the first few weeks. She has passion but no actual teaching capabilities.

Yes, she's a kind, sweet lady but, she is not a good professor, at all! As others have said, she regularly goes off on tangents, and is, at times, hard to follow. The students in the class provide more insight into the films than she does. She tries but falls short. If you want units, take the class but, if you want an experience, don't.

i took photography and anthropology from her in winter 2007, and it was the most boring, pointless waste of an hour and a half EVER. the t.a.'s were okay, but she clearly needs to retire. she's such a nice, sweet lady, but she is getting too old. she would forget what she was saying and went off on tangents, and didn't teach us anything.

She has great insight and knowledge if you allow yourself the chance to get to know her. She might seem a little out there, but pay attention to her tangents and her humor. In the end there's something to take away from her class whether it be understanding multi-media technology, theory, or self-reflection. Allow your self to ride with it.

Shelly is a wonderful professor, she is very fun and makes the lectures very intersting. She is a very caring person. There is minimal reading for the class. The only thing I would comment on is she goes through her lecture slides too fast and sometimes goes off topic.

I liked her as a professor, but you had to put the effort into the class or you weren't going to get anything out of it. She was aware that I was putting more effort into my project than my group mates and she acknowledged that in my grade and evals.
a nice sweet women, but totally unorganized.  Goes of topic.
No Comments
Get to know her on your on time and it will be way rewarding.  If you remain another face in the crowd you won't get anything out of her classes.

All I can say is that Errington needs to retire. It appears that she is in the early stages of Alzhemers. Half the time, she would forget what she was talking about mid way through the lecture.She is the worst teacher I have ever encountered in my academic career. If you do not want to waste your money, I advise you not to take a class from her.

The absolute worst professor I have taken in college.  Lectures by her are a meandering, pointless, horrible experience.  The class was disorganized and uninspiring.  Do not take a class from this professor, please.

Please. Please, if you respect yourself at all, don't take a class with Errington. She is vague, disorganized and extremely unclear. Most of the people in the class have said they STILL have no idea what she is talking about, 8 weeks into the quarter.
